campaignEntries.rawText:
## Melee
| d20 Roll | Mishaps Due to a Critical Failure on a Melee Attack |
| --- | --- |
| 1 | You lose your grip and your weapon flies out of your hand, landing 1d4 x 5 feet away in a random direction. |
| 2 | You miss your enemy and instead hit an unintended object, which sends a shockwave up your arm. You have disadvantage on all attack rolls until the end of your next turn. |
| 3 | You overextend yourself, leaving you not just open, but off-balance. You have disadvantage on your next saving throw. |
| 4 | The miss throws you off, causing your next attack to be at disadvantage. |
| 5 | You slip and fall prone. |
| 6 | As you swing your weapon, a strap or buckle fails and a piece of your armor falls free. Your AC reduces by 1 until repaired. |
| 7 | You swing so hard that you spin around, losing sight of the battlefield. You are surprised until your next action. |
| 8 | Your missed strike leaves you yet more vulnerable. You provide advantage on the next attack made against you. |
| 9 | Your weapon becomes lodged in the ground or a nearby object. You must use an action to free it. |
| 10 | You exhaust yourself with the failed attack. You suffer one level of exhaustion. |
| 11 | You accidentally strike yourself in the recoil. Roll your damage die and take half the rolled damage. |
| 12 | You harmlessly strike a nearby creature who wasn't in melee with you, making yourself their new target. |
| 13 | You let your guard down. The next attack against you has advantage. |
| 14 | You lose your footing and your movement speed is reduced by half until the end of your next turn. |
| 15 | Your swing wildly off-course, and your vision blurs from the off-balance maneuver. You are blinded until the end of your next turn. |
| 16 | In your overzealous offense, you leave your defense wide. The enemy you attacked can make an opportunity attack against you. |
| 17 | You miss your mark and hit a sensitive spot on a nearby ally. Roll weapon damage minus your Strength modifier. Your ally takes that damage (minimum of 1). |
| 18 | Your weapon strikes a nearby hard surface causing a shower of sparks. This catches your eye, distracting you. You are dazed until your next turn. |
| 19 | Your overextended attack leaves you open to a sound blow. The next attack against you automatically hits. |
| 20 | Your missed attack leaves an opening for your enemy. They receive a free immediate melee attack against you. |

## Ranged
| d20 | Ranged Attack Critical Failure Mishap |
|--------|-----------------------------------|
| 1 | The string on your bow snaps, rendering it unusable until a replacement string is found or mended. |
| 2 | Your unleashed projectile errantly strikes an ally instead of the intended target, dealing normal damage. |
| 3 | Your arrow or bolt shatters on release sending sharp splinters into your hand, causing 1d4 piercing damage. |
| 4 | After an improper release, your thrown weapon ends up too far away to be easily retrieved. |
| 5 | Your launched attack not only misses the target but ricochets dangerously — all creatures within 10ft of the target must make a Dexterity saving throw or take 1d4 damage. |
| 6 | Your weapon slips from your grasp and is hurled 10 feet in a random direction. |
| 7 | The pull of the bowstring throws you off-balance – you lose your next reaction. |
| 8 | Your off-target missile accidentally ignites a small, unattended flammable object within range. |
| 9 | An unlucky flick of the wrist leaves your projectile weapon embedded in a nearby tree or wall, out of reach until you spend an action to recover it. |
| 10 | Your poorly loosed ammunition breaks upon impact – subtract that ammunition from your inventory permanently. |
| 11 | Your wild throw or shot scares a local wildlife causing a loud noise that attracts nearby enemies or causes a general disturbance. |
| 12 | Your released projectile inaccurately hits and breaks an object in your pocket, potion, scroll, etc. |
| 13 | Your weapon becomes tangled in your gear. You must spend your next action freeing it. |
| 14 | The physical strain of the botched attack has stressed the weapon – the range of your next shot is halved. |
| 15 | Your ammunition is ruined on the misfire. You lose an additional piece of ammo from your inventory. |
| 16 | A pulled muscle from your effort leaves you temporarily weakened – subtract 1 from all ranged attack rolls until you complete a short rest. |
| 17 | The strong recoil of the attack stumbles you backwards, moving you 5 feet away from your original position. |
| 18 | The weapon is dislodged from your grip, falling to your feet. You must use your next action to retrieve it. |
| 19 | Your aim was so poor that your projectile loops around and lands near the enemy, providing them with an improvised ranged weapon. |
| 20 | Your blundering attack has left you temporarily disoriented – you are Stunned until the end of your next turn. |

## Arcane
| \#  | Mishaps due to a critical failure on an arcane attack |
|---|---|
| 1  | Your spell backfires, causing you to take damage equal to the spell level |
| 2  | A surge of wild magic causes you and all around you to become invisible for 1 round |
| 3  | The spell targets a random ally within range instead of your intended target |
| 4  | Your attack misses wildly, damaging any cover or obstacles near the enemy |
| 5  | You unexpectedly teleport 10 feet in a random direction. If you appear in an occupied space, take 1d6 force damage |
| 6  | Your spell fizzles out entirely. You lose the spell slot without effect |
| 7  | Arcane energy leaks out, causing an antimagic field in a 10-foot radius around you for 1d4 rounds |
| 8  | You accidentally strengthen the enemy, giving them advantage on their next attack |
| 9  | You are momentarily silenced, unable to cast spells that require verbal components for 1 turn |
| 10 | The magical energies you conjure are too volatile, you are stunned until the end of your next turn |
| 11 | Suddenly, you can't remember how to cast any spells. For the next round, you are unable to cast any spells |
| 12 | A gust of wind blows out any lights and sends small unattended objects flying |
| 13 | Arcane energy surges, draining your magical strength. All your spells are at disadvantage for the next turn |
| 14 | A subtle change in the weave of magic around you causes every creature within 10 feet to gain 1d6 temporary hit points |
| 15 | You are knocked prone from the force of the botched spell |
| 16 | A mishap in the casting process causes you to speak only in a foreign language until you next long rest |
| 17 | The ground beneath you becomes difficult terrain from an unexpected outburst of magical energy |
| 18 | You unintentionally create a minor illusion of yourself, that immediately runs away |
| 19 | The spell energy turns inward, absorbing into your weapon making it magical for the next 1d4 rounds |
| 20 | Your spell ricochets back towards you. Make a Dexterity saving throw to dodge it |

## Melee
| D20 Roll | Boon |
|---|---|
| 1 | Your critical strike lands in a vital area. Double your damage dice rolled. |
| 2 | Your attack sends shockwaves through your opponent's body. They're stunned until the end of their next turn. |
| 3 | You find an opening in your opponent's defenses. Your next attack against them has advantage. |
| 4 | Your attack is so forceful it knocks your enemy prone. |
| 5 | Your superior technique allows you to recover a weapon use. |
| 6 | The ferocity of your strike forces your opponent to drop their weapon. |
| 7 | You exploit a weakness in your opponent's armor. They have a -2 penalty to AC until repaired. |
| 8 | The intensity of your attack inflicts a bleeding wound. Your opponent takes 1d4 damage at the start of their turn for the next three rounds. |
| 9 | Your melee attack lands with such accuracy, your enemy's speed is halved until the end of their next turn. |
| 10 | Your forceful attack pushes your enemy back 5 feet. |
| 11 | You disrupt your enemy's attack by attacking their weapon hand. They have disadvantage on their next attack roll. |
| 12 | Inflict an additional 1d6 damage due to precision. |
| 13 | Your opponent is left open after your attack. Allies have advantage on the next attack roll against your opponent. |
| 14 | Your fierce fight style scares nearby enemies. Enemies within 10 feet of you take a -1 penalty to their next attack roll. |
| 15 | You break your enemy's concentration. They cannot cast spells until the end of their next turn. |
| 16 | Your flawless technique lets you make another attack as a bonus action. |
| 17 | Your opponent is so surprised by your attack they are unable to take reactions until their next turn. |
| 18 | Your attack empowers you, restoring 1d4 hit points. |
| 19 | Your devastating strike makes your opponent lose their next bonus action. |
| 20 | Inflict maximum damage on your attack roll, and the target must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be knocked unconscious. |

## Ranged
| d20 Roll | Boon Due to Critical Success on Ranged Attack |
|---|---|
| 1  | Arrow/bolt sparks a chain reaction, causing small, additional explosions (additional 1d6 fire damage to all enemies within a 5-foot radius). |
| 2  | A precision strike disrupts the target's spellcasting. They must succeed a concentration check or lose any spell they are preparing. |
| 3  | Strike hits a vital organ, inflicting an additional 1d4 ongoing bleed damage for 3 rounds. The target can make a DC10 Constitution saving throw to stop the bleeding. |
| 4  | Your projectile ricochets off the target and strikes an additional enemy, roll for attack and damage for the second target. |
| 5  | The sheer power of the shot knocks the enemy back 10 feet, possibly causing falling damage. |
| 6  | Target's extravagant jewelery is hit, causing bits of the expensive material to embed in the target's flesh for an additional 1d4 damage. |
| 7  | Projectile splits into multiple shards upon impact, hitting nearby enemies for half of the initial damage up to 10 feet away. |
| 8  | A quick and nimble shot snatches the weapon out of an enemy's hand, disarming them. |
| 9  | Arrow/bolt goes straight through a weak spot in the enemy's armor, reducing their AC by 1 for the duration of the combat. |
| 10 | With perfect precision, you shoot the enemy's mouth shut, preventing them from casting verbal spells for 1 round. |
| 11 | Your attack scares the enemy, giving them a disadvantage on their next attack roll. |
| 12 | The audacious feat of your shot inspires allies, giving them advantage on their next attack roll. |
| 13 | Your strike results in an intimidating wound, causing other enemies to make a Wisdom saving throw or become frightened. |
| 14 | Passionate power behind the shot results in the target being stunned for their next turn. |
| 15 | An almost impossible shot breaks the opponent's defense, giving your allies an advantage in their attacks against the target until the end of your next turn. |
| 16 | Target's spell component pouch/sacred symbol/component is destroyed, preventing spellcasting requiring these components. |
| 17 | A blindingly quick shot knocks an important object (GM's choice) from the target's possession. |
| 18 | Your shot forces the target to drop prone. |
| 19 | Long-lasting pain distracts the target, giving them a disadvantage on concentration checks until the end of combat. |
| 20 | Your shot is so impressive, it leaves an enduring impression on witnesses. You gain advantage in Intimidation or Persuasion checks (your choice) against them. |

## Arcane
| d20 Roll  | Boon Due to a Critical Success on an Arcane Attack |
|-------------|-----------------------------------------------------|
| 1   | The target is stunned until the end of your next turn.                             |
| 2   | The target is thrown back 10 feet and is knocked prone.                            |
| 3   | The spell's area of effect doubles in size.                                        |
| 4   | The arcane energy leaves the target vulnerable to the spell damage type until the end of your next turn. |
| 5   | The arcane energy heals you for a number of hit points equal to your spellcasting modifier. |
| 6   | Arcane energy remains in the area, acting as difficult terrain for your enemies until the end of your next turn. |
| 7   | The shocking force of the spell inhibits the target's vision, causing their attacks to be at disadvantage until the end of your next turn. |
| 8   | The spell's damage die upgrades one step (i.e., a d6 becomes a d8). |
| 9   | The arcane energy severs the target’s connection to their own magic, preventing them from casting spells until the end of their next turn. |
| 10  | By harnessing the spell's residual energy, your next spell cast before the end of your next turn has its spell level increased by one. |
| 11  | The spell penetrates defenses, ignoring any resistance or immunity the target has to its damage type. |
| 12  | Arcane resonance with the target grants you insight into their vulnerabilities, granting you advantage on your next attack against them. |
| 13  | The spell's arcane energy shields you, providing +2 to your AC until the start of your next turn. |
| 14  | The spell's potency frightens nearby enemies, causing them to have disadvantage on saving throws until the end of your next turn. |
| 15  | The spell's power cascades, dealing half of its original damage to an additional enemy within range. |
| 16  | The extreme precision of your spell allows you to repeat the attack on your next turn using the same roll. |
| 17  | The energy of your spell bolsters allies within 10 feet, giving them a +1 bonus to their next attack roll. |
| 18  | Arcane backlash from the spell tears into otherworldly creatures, dealing additional damage equal to your spellcasting modifier to any summoned or extraplanar beings within the spell's area. |
| 19  | The raw arcane power intimidates your enemies, reducing their speed by half until the end of their next turn. |
| 20  | The target takes damage equal to twice your spellcasting ability modifier at the start of each of their turns for the next minute until they receive magical healing or succeed on a Constitution saving throw at the end of their turn. |

## Aarakocra
| Dice Value | Name | Description |
|------------|------|-------------|
| 1          | Krito | A fiercely loyal Aarakocra soldier with proud, colorful plumage. Skilled in spear combat. |
| 2          |Silaris| A quiet and solemn scholar. Her feathers are a muted grey, matching her serious demeanor. |
| 3          | Pivek | A stern scout with battle-scarred wings. Known for his unerring sense of direction. |
| 4          | Tiroth | An Aarakocra elder, frail but wise. His once vibrant plumage fades more each day. |
| 5          | Lianara | A nimble and agile messenger renowned for her speed. Her feathers are sky blue. |
| 6          | Norath | A hardened warrior, scars crisscrossing his body and wings telling tales of numerous battles. |
| 7          | Hantor | A silent and mysterious hermit. Very few have seen the beautiful, emerald-green of his plumage. |
| 8          | Riala | An experienced healer with soft, calming white feathers. She is deeply respected by her community. |
| 9          | Verath | A patient and persistent hunter. His feathers blend perfectly with the night sky, making him an excellent predator. |
| 10         | Glinara | A knowledgeable navigator renowned for her intricate and accurate maps. Her feathers are a bright yellow. |
| 11         | Thorek | An unyielding guardian known for his incredible strength. His feathers are as grey and solid as stone. |
| 12         | Fesha | A quiet and composed tailor known for crafting the finest clothes and accessories. She has ginger feathers. |
| 13         | Kerith | An Aristocratic Aarakocra, his pristine, white plumage a sign of status. Known for his strict but fair rule. |
| 14         |Meraia| A renowned wind singer. Her soft voice carries over miles, her plumage a vibrant red. |
| 15         | Varial | A heroic figure in the Aarakocra community known for his bravery. His feathers are bronze. |
| 16         | Eliri | Eliri is a promising young scholar. Her feathers are a mix of beautiful purples and blues. |
| 17         | Parvan | Parvan is a skilled blacksmith, respected for his quality work. He has smoky grey feathers. |
| 18         | Antaris | A weather-worn ocean navigator, his feather's color match the frothy ocean waves. |
| 19         | Quinar | Quinar's feathers have lost their color with age, but not his spirit. A storyteller of great importance. |
| 20         | Nalara | An agile huntress, her feathers a blending grey allowing her to disappear into the shadows. |

## Aasimar
| Dice Value | Name | Description |
|---|---|---|
| 1 | Elysia | A solemn Aasimar Paladin in gleaming armor, she holds a profound sense of justice. |
| 2 | Galathiel | A reserved Aasimar Cleric, he brings comfort and healing to all in need. |
| 3 | Seraph | A dutiful Aasimar Ranger, her celestial heritage can be seen in her glowing eyes. |
| 4 | Orion | A hardened Aasimar Fighter, he wears battle scars with pride and dignity. |
| 5 | Altariel | A composed Aasimar Wizard, she hands down divine knowledge with composure. |
| 6 | Nemara | A serene Aasimar Monk, her movements are fluid and filled with quiet power. |
| 7 | Telindra | A calm Aasimar Druid, she’s in perfect harmony with the nature around her. |
| 8 | Luminor | A watchful Aasimar Rogue, his moral compass never wavers. |
| 9 | Thaliel | A stoic Aasimar Sorcerer, her magic hums with a celestial energy. |
| 10 | Sariel | A steadfast Aasimar Bard, her songs fill listeners with a sense of peace and hope. |
| 11 | Elanis | A solemn Aasimar Warlock, his celestial pact allows him to channel divine energy. |
| 12 | Ithariel | A composed Aasimar Artificer, she constructs intricate mechanisms blessed by divine hands. |
| 13 | Arisa | A watchful Aasimar Mystic, her celestial lineage is clearly visible in her astral powers. |
| 14 | Caelum | A calm Aasimar Oracle, his visions are bestowed by celestial deities. |
| 15 | Deliah | An unwavering Aasimar Knight, she’s the shining beacon amidst bleak battles. |
| 16 | Uriel | A sturdy Aasimar Paladin, he serves celestial hosts with undying loyalty. |
| 17 | Solaria | A dutiful Aasimar Healer, her gentle touch can relieve the most severe wounds. |
| 18 | Celestia | A serene Aasimar Seer, her prophetic visions are blessings from celestial planes. |
| 19 | Archael | A watchful Aasimar Guardian, his celestial might is induced by divine justice. |
| 20 | Evandor | A composed Aasimar Prophet, he foresees the divine will with uncanny precision. |

## Bugbear
| Dice Value | Name            | Description                                                                                 |
|------------|-----------------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| 1          | Culdrak         | A tall, rancorous Bugbear with sharp teeth and red eyes. He has distinctive tribal tattoos. |
| 2          | Broken Tooth    | A menacing, one-eyed Bugbear. He is missing his left canine, giving him his name.            |
| 3          | Thokk           | A massively built Bugbear snarling with malice. Covered in scar tissue from many battles.   |
| 4          | Snarl           | A hulking Bugbear with a harsh and raspy voice. His eyes brim with undisguised hatred.      |
| 5          | Kreeg           | A lean, fast Bugbear with a cunning gaze. He's responsible for numerous raids.              |
| 6          | Grizzle         | An old and lighter-colored Bugbear. His experience and wisdom make him deadly.             |
| 7          | Bone-Nose       | A hunchbacked Bugbear with an eerie bone piercing his broad nose. Terrifying and mysterious.|
| 8          | Flesh-Tearer    | A Bugbear with vicious claws and a notorious reputation for savagery.                       |
| 9          | Skrug           | A Bugbear brawler with an intimidation factor that matches his immense size.                |
| 10         | Iron Hide       | A Bugbear with an unusually thick skin that has thwarted many sword strokes.                |
| 11         | Ravage          | A brutal Bugbear warrior who revels in the heat of battle. Marred with numerous tattoos.    |
| 12         | Sneer           | A treacherous Bugbear with a nasty smile, always planning something sinister.               |
| 13         | Blight          | An eerie Bugbear shaman, marked with ritualistic scarring. His gaze holds a dark promise.   |
| 14         | Gutwrench       | A hideous Bugbear butcher known for his cruel and unusual methods.                          |
| 15         | Crackle         | A Bugbear who has perfected the art of torture. His maniacal laughter is the stuff of legends.    |
| 16         | Rend            | An agile Bugbear striker, silent and deadly, his foes often don't know they're targeted until too late.    |
| 17         | Blackclaw       | A ruthless Bugbear with onyx-black claws, his reputation of terror precedes him.    |
| 18         | Crag            | A Bugbear with a weathered and rugged exterior, his cold stare speaks of countless battles. |
| 19         | Flint           | A scarred Bugbear, his flint-hard countenance has seen it all and fears none.   |
| 20         | Gorefix         | A hulking Bugbear chief, his brutal strategies have led to widespread fear and respect among his clan. |

## Changeling
| Dice Value | Name | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| 1 | Hrix | A stoic Changeling who tends to mirror the attitudes and behaviors of those around them—whether for better or worse. |
| 2 | Adeya | A watchful Changeling spy with an array of carefully practiced faces. Known for carrying out covert operations with serious precision. |
| 3 | Bris | A hardened Changeling bounty hunter who has an uncanny ability to track their prey across wildly disparate environments. |
| 4 | Japha | A weary Changeling penman who has perfected the handwriting of hundreds of royal scribes, clerks, and dignitaries over the years. |
| 5 | Thell | A quiet Changeling cleric who serves the god of change and transition, striving in every action to act as a reflection of their deity's desire for flux and evolution. |
| 6 | Dez | A ruthless Changeling mercenary known for their cruel efficiency on the battlefield. Perfectly blending into enemy ranks only to wreak havoc within them. |
| 7 | Nalma | A diligent Changeling herbalist with a deep understanding of vegetation from across the realm, frequently used to concoct useful potions and incense. |
| 8 | Yil | A cautious changeling wanderer who has mastered the mannerisms of a broad spectrum of races, both common and rare, in their wealth of travels. |
| 9 | Unin | An agile Changeling thief who uses their transformative abilities to evade capture and infiltrate high-security areas with near faultless accuracy. |
| 10 | Eirz | A shrewd Changeling tradesman whose ever-changing appearance allows them to negotiate with clients of various races and backgrounds, always offering the perfect deal. |
| 11 | Vola | A renowned Changeling fencer known both for the elegance of her movements and her intimidating, cold focus in combat. |
| 12 | Host | A meditative Changeling shapeshifter renowned for their mastery over their body's transformations, reputed to have studied under ancient druids. |
| 13 | Gan | A pious Changeling devotee who serves a mysterious deity and mirage of appearances, depending on the religious persuasion of those they encounter. |
| 14 | Shire | A self-controlled Changeling courtier who leverages their unique racial abilities to subtly manipulate court politics behind the scenes. |
| 15 | Zont | A determined Changeling archaeologist who uses their shape-changing abilities to decipher ancient texts and explore dangerous ruins. |
| 16 | Reem | A dutiful Changeling knight who keeps their true identity hidden beneath the suit of armor. Their name is spoken with a mix of reverence and fear. |
| 17 | Halix | A withdrawn Changeling librarian that makes use of their shape-shifting to pose as different librarians in various libraries around the kingdom. |
| 18 | Qilo | A somber Changeling soothsayer who uses the colors and shapes of their own body to tell fortunes - their abilities earned them a serious reputation. |
| 19 | Omender | A meticulous Changeling investigator with an uncanny knack unleashing their transformative abilities to crack the most complex of cases. |
| 20 | Tysh | An enigmatic Changeling who lives as a recluse on the edge of civilization—they welcome visitors but change faces with each one, creating an air of surveillance and unease. |

## Dragon
| Dice Value | Name | Description |
|---|---|---|
| 1 | Pyrrhus | An ancient red dragon with scales scarred from countless battles. His eyes gleam with intelligence and a fiery determination. |
| 2 | Seraphina | A young silver dragon, curious and intelligent, but more reserved in her interactions with non-dragons. Her scales shimmer brightly, reflecting the daylight. |
| 3 | Oculus | An adult crystal dragon, sees all and knows all within its domain. Its body almost entirely transparent, it is hard to discern its exact shape.  |
| 4 | Tempest | A storm blue dragon with an affinity for the sea. It's rumored that Tempest controls the ocean currents and the storms that frequent the coast. |
| 5 | Thundertail | An ancient bronze dragon with scales that have turned green due to age. Thundertail is a supernatural creature capable of casting powerful lightning attacks. |
| 6 | Obsidian | An adult black dragon, fearsome and self-absorbed, lives in the heart of a dark swamp. Its acid breath is as notorious as its cruel cunning. |
| 7 | Elysium | A celestial dragon maintaining the balance of life and death. It's known for its multicolored scales and eyes that resemble twin galaxies. |
| 8 | Viridian | A green dragon renowned for its woodland camouflage, poisonous breath, and duplicitous nature. |
| 9 | Frostguard | A white dragon known for its icy demeanor and chilling aura. It is said that breathe from Frostguard can freeze a man to death in mere moments. |
| 10 | Solarflare | Known mostly through legends, Solarflare is a sun dragon whose golden scales are said to blaze brighter than the sun itself. |
| 11 | Breach | A mountain dragon widely known for causing landslides and earth-shattering quakes. Breach's earth-colored scales make him blend effortlessly with rocky terrains |
| 12 | Marina | A water dragon known to manipulate water bodies. She mostly lives in seclusion in a vast oceanic abyss. |
| 13 | Nekros | A shadow dragon that has the capacity to step between worlds, Nekros has terrorized many realm with his chilling presence. |
| 14 | Crystalis | A rare gem dragon whose scintillating scales are sought after for their magical properties. She is a peaceful being generally but possesses immense power. |
| 15 | Stardust | An ageless star dragon known for its cosmic breath and wisdom spanning millenniums. Stardust's body glows with a dim light from a distance like a star. |
| 16 | Whisper | A cloud dragon who remains hidden, creating and guiding wind currents. Her voice is said to be heard in the rustling of leaves and the howling of wind. |
| 17 | Balefire | A volcanic dragon that dwells deep within an active volcano. The radiating heat surrounding Balefire makes it near impossible for anyone to approach.   |
| 18 | Prism | A light dragon who has the power to bend light to its will. It is said that gazing directly at Prism is akin to staring into the sun. |
| 19 | Vanta | Known in whispers across the lands as a void dragon, Vanta consumes all matter and energy in its path. No one knows its true appearance. |
| 20 | Wyrmheart | A time dragon who exists between the present and future. Wyrmheart's ancient and gnarled appearance is said to be an embodiment of the passage of time itself. |

## Dragonborn
| Dice Value | Name | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| 1 | Tarhun Goldentide | A seasoned warrior, Tarhun stands proudly, his golden scales catching the light brilliantly. His focus on honor is unwavering, and his stern gaze reveals a strict sense of duty. |
| 2 | Korthiv Deepfire | Scholar and sage, Korthiv's red scales are reminiscent of deep lava flows. His knowledge in arcane is immense, bringing a sense of respect and seriousness to his character. |
| 3 | Sivex Shadowfang | This Dragonborn rogue, with blackened scales, is full of stealth and intrigue. He may not say much, but his actions speak of a deadly precision and seriousness. |
| 4 | Paelias Wavecrash | A blue-scaled sailor, Paelias has a commanding presence, his cool gaze as deep as the ocean. He's all about discipline, promising a severe punishment for those who dare cross him. |
| 5 | Mireili Smokeheart | Mireili is an alchemist and healer with ash-gray scales. Her calm, composed demeanor is set off by her unwavering resolve to aid those in need with her potent concoctions. |
| 6 | Gwennith Frozenspire | Gwennith is an icy white Dragonborn, a cleric who upholds her deity's teachings with an ardent zeal that few can match. She is formal to the point of appearing cold. |
| 7 | Nemeia Emberclaw | This Dragonborn wizard's red scales reflect her affinity with fire magic. Her dedication to scholarly pursuits makes her a serious individual, focused on her magical research. |
| 8 | Zephyr Windrider | His silver scales shimmering like gusty wind, Zephyr is a ranger soaring the skies. He holds himself to a rigorous code which makes his character austere and intimidating. |
| 9 | Elysia Lightgaze | A cleric with golden scales, Elysia is devoted to her deity, embodying a clear respect for laws and order, making her a truly determined defender of the faith. |
| 10 | Torgar Hammerfall | Torgar, a black-scaled Dragonborn, is a stern blacksmith. He is serious about his craft, producing melee weapons of exceptional quality with austere dedication. |
| 11 | Draax Thunderroar | Draax's bronze scales echo his affinity for lightning and storms. This Paladin is disciplined and stern, using his divine powers to maintain balance and order. |
| 12 | Tharyssa Icebound | Tharyssa is a noble fighter adept with the greatsword. Her icy blue scales mirror her austere nature and precise fighting style that she relentlessly maintains. |
| 13 | Seraphus Skyshaper | Seraphus, a blue-scaled Dragonborn, is a storm sorcerer of great power. His solemn manner conveys the monumental weight of controlling the weather within his palms. |
| 14 | Caladrel Moonbeam | Caladrel's silver scales reflect the moonlight, aligning with his profession as a nocturnal scout. His quiet and serious demeanor make him a trustworthy ally in dangerous tasks. |
| 15 | Molikar Stoneheart | A heavily built earth shaper, Molikar's brown scales exude a sense of strength and resolve. This geomancer takes his role with profound gravity and utter dedication. |
| 16 | Nortis Galewing | With silver scales, Nortis is a serious Dragonborn bard. Despite his musical talent, he is no jester, instead preferring solemn, historical epics and ballads. |
| 17 | Kythorn Greenmantle | A green-scaled Dragonborn druid, Kythorn often keeps his emotions under close wraps, preferring to be serious and conscious of the balance in nature. |
| 18 | Cyndor Sunbrand | Cyndor, a paladin with golden scales, holds his duty to his order in the highest regard. His solemnity is palpable, holding his convictions severely firm. |
| 19 | Sheldrake Ironscale | Sheldrake is a red-scaled blacksmith. His craft is everything to him, and his work exudes a serious dedication to strength and resilience. |
| 20 | Selarn Dawnbreaker | Selarn, a golden-scaled Dragonborn, is a vigilant sentinel. Her solemn demeanor and dedicated service to her group reveal an uncompromising character. |

## Drow
| Dice Value | Name | Description |
|---|---|---|
| 1 | Vorn Jaelre | A stern-faced drow cleric, dedicated to the service of Lolth and her chaotic precepts. |
| 2 | Adinida Mizzrym | A skilled and calculating drow rogue, always plotting her next move from the shadows. |
| 3 | Aevor Brundreth | A fearless drow warrior with a brutal reputation on the battlefield. |
